args:
Norwin has finally found the key to the mystery!
Taking advantage of the workings of the island,
the group traps Carmen and manages to revive
their fallen comrades. The party then begins the
decisive showdown with Scylla, who is furious
that her scheme has gone awry.
You're wrong, Norwin. It's not me.
No, you are the one who killed Mikotoâ€”\nand Patia as well.
Elisanne is also likely your fault.
But why did you kill everyone, Amane?
I didn't kill ANYONE! Norwin is just\nmisunderstanding something!
She's rightâ€”she didn't kill everyone.\nI, for example, killed Cleo.
I don't know the situation with Luca,\nbut based on the circumstances, I believe\nElisanne was the one who killed Ranzal.
I am very confused right now.
I will explain in order. First, my theory is\npremised on the fact Scylla has NOT,\nin fact, disguised herself as one of us.
But the note we found said she did!

It said she did so for THAT particular
person in THAT particular game.
We merely assumed the same situation
applied to us in the here and now.
You seem very confident about that.

Let me pose a small thought exercise:
Assume that, for the sake of argument,
I am Scylla in disguise. In this case,
where is the actual Norwin?
Well, I suppose Scylla killed you\nbefore pretending to be you.
No, but wait. That means the number\nof dolls doesn't match up.
Right. If she'd killed someone to take\ntheir place, there would have to be\none more doll than there is.
Okay, so Scylla's not here. That's groovy.\nBut then how is everyone's soul being\nvacuumed outta their body?
Indeed, I have never heard of such a\nskill in all my wanderings.
For that, we look to the island's curse.
You mean the story you told us the first\nnight about an evil villain who lives here\ndevouring souls?
Correct. If that was a warning about Scylla,\nthen we can't ignore it. And the exact\ntale of the curse was...
ï¼‚This island is a place of suspicion. One\nmust never let the words tempt them.ï¼‚

ï¼‚A place of suspicionï¼‚? So we're
SUPPOSED to be suspicious of
things here? Because if so,
I am WAY ahead of you.
Yes, and I believe the second part is\na warning regarding that. It's telling\nus we must maintain suspicion.

Specifically, the tale of the curse is a
warning not to let ï¼‚wordsï¼‚ tempt us into
abandoning suspicion. That is, we are
not to reply to words of TRUST.
Can you maybe explain this slowly?\nPretend I'm not all that bright.
On this island, there are words\nthat serve as a trigger for death.
And those are the words we aren't\nsupposed to reply to, correct?\nThe ones specifically about trust?
So if someone says they trust you,\nand you reply that you do as well,\nthen you die?
That was my initial suspicionâ€”and when\nI heard the conversation between Amane\nand Mikoto earlier, I became sure of it.
I believe that to be the reason people\nsay this island is cursed.
If that is the case, it means I was the\none who triggered things for Mikoto,\nPatia, AND Elisanne.
And I triggered it for Cleo.
Luca might have been my fault.\nWe were having a conversation that night,\nand I'm sure the subject came up.
Well, weeeell! What a bunch of smarties!\n...So whatcha gonna do about it?
You figured it out, yaaaay. So what now?
You don't think this actually\nCHANGES anything, do you?
DO YOU NEVER SHUT UP?! SERIOUSLY!
No, she's right. We may have figured out\nhow the game works, but that doesn't\nmean our problems are over.
Even if the game ends right now,\nwe'll still be trapped on the island.
But it DOES mean we can stop people\nfrom dying, which buys us some time\nto figure out a solution to that issue.
You DO realize you're just accepting\nNorwin's random hunch about the whole\nï¼‚don't say you trust peopleï¼‚ thing, right?

I mean, heck! What if another word is the
trigger? What if a BUNCH of words are?
Oh man, if I were you, I'd be reeeally
worried about dying tomorrow...
I knew you would say something like that.\nLuckily, proving it is simple.
We just have to try the method\nand see what happens.
So somebody has to AGREE to die?!
No need to worry: I trust everyone here.\nEven if I die and turn into a doll,\nI will eventually be revived.
I appreciate your determination, Amane,\nbut we're getting ahead of ourselves.
If we're really going to test this theory,\nwe need to establish the parameters\nof our experiment.

For example, it needs to be a reply,
but does context have any bearing?
Does a person actually need to MEAN it,
or is simply saying the phrase enough?
There are many possible permutations\nto this curse that must be considered.
So you want to know if the words will\ntrigger the trap even if they are a lie.
I see no point in confirming that.
Empty trust has no meaningâ€”it's absurd\nto think such a thing could kill us.
Now THAT sounds like a challenge!\nWhy not go ahead and try it, mmm?
Say it! See if you die even if\nthe words are a lie!
Heck, I'll even start you off, since I don't\nreally care what happens to you.
I'll tell you that I trust you, then you reply\nto me and we'll see if you croak!
Oh Amane... I trust you soooo muuuch!
Come on, don't chicken out now!\nSay it! Say it, say it, saaaay iiiiit.
Oh my gosh. She's right. You didn't pose\nthe words, Carmenâ€”you REPLIED to them.
I said but a moment ago, I believe in\neveryone here. ...EVERYONE, Carmen.\nAnd that includes you.
So when you said you believed in Amane,\nyou triggered the curse on YOURSELF.
What the...? Wait, you tricked me!
We are the game pieces;\nyou are the board.
If we wish to forcibly quit this game,\nour only choice is to flip the board over.
Oh, you are gonna REGRET this, big-time!
Oh, and Car-Car? If you're hoping to get\nhelp from Scylla, you'll want to do it fast.

Indeed, the time between saying the
words and the curse going into effect
is not a set one. For all we know, you
could drop dead in the very next moment.
I'll never forgive... I'll NEVER forgive...\nNever... Neeev...eeeeer...
There's no way Scylla is going to\ntake this development well.
I won't forgive you for spoiling my fun!
WE'RE the ones who won't forgive YOU!\nHow dare you treat us like utter rubes!
That's enough. The game is over...\nso I'll tear you to shreds MYSELF!
Hrk... Her mana is on a totally different\nlevel than when we fought her before!
The hell, guys? Why is Scylla here?
Oh my gosh, I KNOW that voice!
Save the celebrations for later!\nFirst, we must defeat Scylla.
I don't know the specifics, but it looks as\nthough you've done beautifullyâ€”so all that\nis left is to end this abomination of nature.
My frustrations have been building up\nnon-stop since we got to this island,\nand I'm going to vent them all on HER!
Fools, all of you. Your deaths would have\nbeen so much easier had you just\nobediently become my dolls...
At least I'll enjoy the sounds of you\nscreaming in regret as you die!
